snippet: The first national youth orchestra in the United States, whose players are 16 to 19, rehearsed this week with the conductor Valery Gergiev.
abstract: National Youth Orchestra of the United States of America, first orchestra of its kind in the US, rehearses with conductor Valery Gergiev for their debut at Performing Arts Center of Purchase College; group, consisting of 120 musicians aged 16 to 19, had been created by Weill Music Institute, educational arm of Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: The first national youth orchestra in the United States, whose players are 16 to 19, rehearsed this week with the conductor Valery Gergiev.

headline.seo: National Youth Orchestra Braces for Its Debut
headline.main: Young, Ecstatic and on the Cusp
headline.print_headline: Young, Ecstatic and on the Cusp
